更.definition: more; even more; further; still; still more

更上一層樓.definition: to take it up a notch; to bring it up a level

更代.definition: substitution; replacing former general; change of leader

更僕難數.definition: too many to count; very many; innumerable

更動.definition: to change; to replace; to alter

更勝.definition: to be even better than; to be superior to

更勝一籌.definition: superior by a notch; a cut above; even better

更始.definition: to make a new start; to regenerate

更張.definition: lit. to restring one's bow; to reform and start over again

更換.definition: to replace (a worn-out tire etc); to change (one's address etc)

更新.definition: to replace the old with new; to renew; to renovate; to upgrade; to update; to regenerate

更新世.definition: Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)

更替.definition: to take over (from one another); to alternate; to replace; to relay

更樓.definition: watch tower; drum tower marking night watches

更次.definition: one watch (i.e. two-hour period during night)

更正.definition: to correct; to make a correction

更深人靜.definition: deep at night and all is quiet (idiom)

更漏.definition: water clock used to mark night watches

更生.definition: resurrection; rebirth; reinvigorated; rejuvenated; a new lease of life

更衣.definition: to change clothes; to go to the toilet (euphemism)

更衣室.definition: change room; dressing room; locker room; (euphemism) toilet

更鼓.definition: drum marking night watches; night watchman's clapper
